alert.note: Alert for Dade (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 11:55AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Dade, Greene, Jasper and Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1155 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Spring River at County Road 2110, Sac River at County Road 1247, Clear Creek at Farm Road 87 and Turnback Creek at County Road 2100. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 49 near mile marker 41. Interstate 44 between mile markers 30 and 70. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
